title: Unify controls derivation and remove per-state controls field
description:
## Problem

Each per-state struct has its own `controls: Vec<Control>` field and a `derive_controls()` method:
- GameBoardState::derive_controls() (game_board.rs:60-98)
- ReviewBoardState::derive_controls() (review_board.rs:48-77)
- GameBoardPaneFocusedState::derive_controls() (game_board_pane_focused.rs:34-45)

Additionally, the renderer in renderer.rs:170-237 has ANOTHER copy of controls rendering that hardcodes its own control labels for review vs game mode, completely independent of the per-state controls.

This means controls are defined in at least two places and can get out of sync.

## What needs to happen

1. Create a single function that derives controls from current state:
   ```rust
   pub fn derive_controls(mode: &UiMode, focus: &FocusMode, game_mode: &GameMode, game_session: &GameSession) -> Vec<Control>
   ```

2. Remove `controls` field and `derive_controls()` from all per-state structs

3. Update the Controls component in renderer.rs to use the shared derive_controls() function instead of hardcoding labels

4. Remove the UiState::controls() method from mod.rs:75-84

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/game_board.rs (remove controls field + derive_controls)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/review_board.rs (remove controls field + derive_controls)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/game_board_pane_focused.rs (remove controls field + derive_controls)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/review_board_pane_focused.rs (remove controls)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/renderer.rs (use shared controls derivation)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/mod.rs (remove UiState::controls())

## Acceptance criteria
- Controls are derived from a single function
- No per-state struct stores controls
- Controls bar at bottom of screen shows correct keys for each mode/context
- Renderer Component::Controls reads from the shared function
close_reason: Extracted shared derive_controls() on UiStateMachine. Renderer now uses Vec<Control> from the shared function. Removed dead controls fields from StartScreenState and MatchSummaryState.

title: Extract shared input handlers to eliminate 3x code duplication
description:
## Problem

Input handling in input.rs has massive code duplication across three context handlers:

### Review navigation (n/p/Space/Home/End) — duplicated 3 times:
- handle_board_context() lines 96-181 (review mode branch)
- handle_component_selected_context() lines 519-556
- handle_component_expanded_context() lines 651-688

### Tab navigation logic — duplicated 2 times:
- handle_board_context() lines 145-174 (review mode Tab)
- handle_board_context() lines 191-219 (game mode Tab)

### Scroll logic with magic number 5 — appears 6 times:
- handle_component_selected_context() lines 588, 593, 597, 601
- handle_component_expanded_context() lines 692, 697
- game_board_pane_focused FSM state mod.rs lines 226-249
- review_board_pane_focused FSM state mod.rs lines 271-297

## What needs to happen

1. Extract a shared function for review navigation:
   ```rust
   fn handle_review_navigation(review: &mut ReviewState, key: KeyCode) -> bool
   ```
   Returns true if the key was consumed. Call from all three contexts.

2. Extract a shared function for tab/pane navigation:
   ```rust
   fn handle_tab_navigation(fsm: &mut UiStateMachine, state: &GameSession, key: KeyEvent) -> bool
   ```

3. Extract scroll handling with a named constant:
   ```rust
   const SCROLL_INCREMENT: u16 = 5;
   fn handle_scroll(component_manager: &mut ComponentManager, component: &Component, key: KeyCode) -> bool
   ```

4. Replace all duplicated blocks with calls to the shared functions

5. Remove the scroll handling from the FSM #[state] methods (game_board_pane_focused, review_board_pane_focused) since input.rs already handles it

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/input.rs (extract shared functions, replace duplicated blocks)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/mod.rs (remove duplicated scroll from #[state] methods)

## Acceptance criteria
- Review navigation code exists in exactly ONE place
- Tab navigation code exists in exactly ONE place
- Scroll logic uses a named constant and exists in exactly ONE place
- No behavioral changes — all key bindings work identically
close_reason: Extracted handle_review_navigation() and handle_tab_navigation() shared functions, replaced SCROLL_INCREMENT constant for magic number 5. All 3 duplication sites now call shared code.

title: Implement map_key_to_message() pure mapper
description:
Add the pure mapping function and its private helpers to client-tui/src/ui/input.rs. This function takes an InputContext and KeyEvent and returns a Message — no mutation, no async, no side effects.

## Public function

pub fn map_key_to_message(ctx: &InputContext, key: KeyEvent) -> Message

Dispatch order (matches existing handle_key priority):
1. tab_input_active -> map_tab_input_key()
2. popup_menu_active -> map_popup_key()
3. snapshot_dialog_active -> map_snapshot_dialog_key()
4. promotion_active -> map_promotion_key()
5. Ctrl+C -> Message::Quit
6. @/#/$ -> Message::TogglePanel(component)
7. Dispatch by (focused_component, expanded):
   - (None, _) -> map_board_context_key()
   - (Some(_), false) -> map_component_selected_key()
   - (Some(_), true) -> map_component_expanded_key()

## Private helpers

### map_tab_input_key(ctx, key) -> Message
- Esc -> TabInputCancel
- Backspace -> TabInputBackspace
- Enter -> TabInputConfirm
- Char(c): validate using ctx.tab_input_buffer_len (0: a-h, 1: 1-8, >=2: reject). Valid -> TabInputChar(c), invalid -> Noop
- _ -> Noop

### map_popup_key(key) -> Message
- Up/'k' -> MenuUp
- Down/'j' -> MenuDown
- Enter -> MenuSelect
- Esc -> MenuCancel
- _ -> Noop

### map_snapshot_dialog_key(ctx, key) -> Message
Routes based on ctx.snapshot_dialog_focus:
- Esc -> SnapshotCancel
- Tab -> SnapshotNextFocus
- Enter -> SnapshotConfirm
- 'j' if focus != Name -> SnapshotNextFocus
- 'k' if focus != Name -> SnapshotPrevFocus
- Left/'h' if MovesBack -> SnapshotDecrement
- Right/'l' if MovesBack -> SnapshotIncrement
- Left/'h' if PlayNow -> SnapshotSetPlayNow(true)
- Right/'l' if PlayNow -> SnapshotSetPlayNow(false)
- Char(c) if Name -> SnapshotCharInput(c)
- Backspace if Name -> SnapshotBackspace
- _ -> Noop

### map_promotion_key(key) -> Message
- Char(c) -> PromotionChar(c)
- Esc -> PromotionCancel
- _ -> Noop

### map_board_context_key(ctx, key) -> Message
Two sub-paths based on ctx.is_review_mode:

Review mode path:
- Shared review navigation first (n/p/Space/Home/End -> ReviewNextCritical/ReviewPrevCritical/ReviewToggleAutoPlay/ReviewGoToStart/ReviewGoToEnd)
- Right/'l' -> ReviewNextPly, Left/'h' -> ReviewPrevPly
- 's' -> OpenSnapshotDialog
- Tab -> FocusNextPane
- Esc -> OpenMenu
- _ -> Noop

Non-review (board) path:
- 'i' if !input_disabled -> ActivateTabInput
- Tab -> FocusNextPane (with Shift detection for FocusPrevPane)
- 'p' if has_engine -> TogglePause
- Char(c) if !input_disabled -> BufferPush(c)
- Backspace -> BufferPop
- Enter -> BufferSubmit
- Esc: if has_selected_square -> ClearSelection, else -> OpenMenu
- _ -> Noop

### map_component_selected_key(ctx, key) -> Message
- Forward review navigation if is_review_mode (n/p/Space/Home/End)
- Left/'h' -> FocusNextSection, Right/'l' -> FocusPrevSection (wait - check original: Left goes to prev_section, Right to next_section)
- Tab/Shift+Tab -> FocusNextPane/FocusPrevPane
- '1' if ReviewSummary -> ReviewTab(0), '2' if ReviewSummary -> ReviewTab(1)
- Shift+Up/Shift+j, 'J' -> ScrollUp; Shift+Down/Shift+k, 'K' -> ScrollDown
- Up/'j' (no shift) -> FocusNextInSection; Down/'k' (no shift) -> FocusPrevInSection
- PageUp -> ScrollToTop, PageDown -> ScrollToBottom
- Enter if expandable -> ExpandPane
- Esc -> ClearFocus
- _ -> Noop

NOTE on j/k direction: In the original code, Up/'j' maps to next_in_section and Down/'k' maps to prev_in_section. Preserve this exactly.

### map_component_expanded_key(ctx, key) -> Message
- Forward review navigation if is_review_mode (n/p/Space/Home/End)
- Up/'k' -> ScrollUp, Down/'j' -> ScrollDown
- PageUp -> ScrollToTop, PageDown -> ScrollToBottom
- Esc -> ClearFocus
- _ -> Noop

## Acceptance criteria
- Pure function: no &mut, no async, no side effects
- Mirrors existing handle_* dispatch exactly — same key in same context produces the semantic equivalent
- cargo build succeeds (function added but not yet called from render loop)
- All existing tests pass
close_reason: Implemented map_key_to_message() pure mapper function and all private helpers. Added snapshot dialog context fields to InputContext. Build succeeds and all tests pass.

title: Flatten UI state: remove duplicated fields from per-state structs
description:
## Problem

UiStateMachine has UI state fields at the top level (tab_input, input_phase, component_manager, popup_menu, snapshot_dialog, review_tab, review_moves_selection, selected_promotion_piece) in mod.rs:124-135. But the per-state structs ALSO have their own copies of many of these fields:

- GameBoardState (states/game_board.rs:10-21): has tab_input, input_phase, input_buffer, popup_menu, snapshot_dialog, paused
- ReviewBoardState (states/review_board.rs:7-15): has review_tab, review_moves_selection, input_buffer, review_ui

The per-state copies are DEAD WEIGHT — input.rs reads/writes from UiStateMachine's top-level fields, not the state struct fields. This causes confusion about which is authoritative.

## What needs to happen

1. Audit each field in GameBoardState, ReviewBoardState, GameBoardPaneFocusedState, ReviewBoardPaneFocusedState to determine if it's actually read anywhere
2. Remove fields that duplicate UiStateMachine top-level fields (tab_input, input_phase, popup_menu, snapshot_dialog, etc.)
3. Keep only fields that are genuinely state-specific (e.g. render_spec, controls, focused_component)
4. Update any code that reads from per-state fields to read from UiStateMachine instead
5. Verify the stored RenderSpec in each state struct — most layout() methods compute layout dynamically already, so the stored render_spec may be removable too

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/game_board.rs (remove duplicated fields)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/review_board.rs (remove duplicated fields)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/game_board_pane_focused.rs (check for duplication)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/review_board_pane_focused.rs (check for duplication)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/mod.rs (ensure top-level fields are the single authority)

## Acceptance criteria
- No field exists in both a per-state struct AND UiStateMachine
- All input.rs and render_loop.rs code reads from a single authoritative location
- All existing functionality still works (pane selection, scrolling, input, review mode)
close_reason: Removed dead render_spec and controls fields from GameBoardState and ReviewBoardState. Removed unused derive_controls(), new(), UiState::render_spec(), and UiState::controls() methods. Cleaned up stale tests. Layout is computed dynamically; controls are rendered inline by the renderer.

title: Bug: expanded pane replaces entire layout with columns instead of replacing board
description:
When a pane is expanded, the entire layout becomes a flat column layout (all panels side-by-side). This is wrong. The correct behavior is:

1. The layout should remain the same (board + side panels)
2. The expanded pane should replace the board area (take the board's position/size)
3. The original pane location in the sidebar should be grayed out to indicate it is currently expanded into the board area

Screenshots show:
- Game mode normal: board on left, info/engine/history stacked on right (correct)
- Game mode expanded: all panels become columns side-by-side, board disappears (bug)
- Review mode normal: analysis+summary on left, board center, info+history on right (correct)
- Review mode expanded: all panels become columns side-by-side, board disappears (bug)
close_reason: Fixed layout_with_expanded in both game_board.rs and review_board.rs to reuse the column structure from normal layout, just replacing Board with expanded pane. Previously it was creating a flat 4-column layout. Now it maintains the nested column structure (center + right columns for game, left + center + right for review). Build succeeds, all tests pass.

title: Replace statig FSM with simple UiMode enum
description:
## Problem

The statig FSM framework adds complexity without proportional value. Evidence:

1. Most #[state] methods are empty pass-throughs:
   - game_board() (mod.rs:195-203): returns Outcome::Handled for all keys
   - review_board() (mod.rs:207-215): returns Outcome::Handled for all keys

2. The code bypasses statig with unsafe:
   - render_loop.rs:490: `unsafe { fsm.inner_mut() }` to get mutable access
   
3. Input.rs directly mutates current_state instead of using transitions:
   - input.rs:622-624: `fsm.current_state = UiState::review_board_pane_focused(component)`
   - input.rs:629-636: `fsm.current_state = UiState::review_board()`

4. PaneFocused variants are redundant — FocusMode in ComponentManager already tracks this:
   - GameBoardPaneFocused exists only to intercept scroll keys (handled by input.rs)
   - ReviewBoardPaneFocused is identical to GameBoardPaneFocused

## What needs to happen

1. Define a simple UiMode enum replacing UiState:
   ```rust
   #[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq)]
   pub enum UiMode {
       StartScreen,
       GameBoard,
       ReviewBoard,
       MatchSummary,
   }
   ```
   No PaneFocused variants — pane focus is tracked by ComponentManager.focus_mode.

2. Replace UiStateMachine's statig integration:
   - Remove `#[state_machine]` attribute and all `#[state]` methods from mod.rs:154-330
   - Replace `current_state: UiState` with `mode: UiMode`
   - Move transition logic (StartScreen -> GameBoard, etc.) into simple methods on UiStateMachine
   - Remove the statig dependency from Cargo.toml

3. Update render_loop.rs:
   - Remove `use statig::blocking::IntoStateMachineExt`
   - Replace `let mut fsm = UiStateMachine::default().state_machine()` with `let mut fsm = UiStateMachine::default()`
   - Remove `fsm.handle(&UiEvent::Key(key))` call (line 488) — input.rs handles everything
   - Remove `unsafe { fsm.inner_mut() }` — direct access to fsm
   - Keep `fsm.handle(&UiEvent::TimerTick)` or replace with direct method

4. Update input.rs:
   - Replace `fsm.current_state = UiState::game_board()` with `fsm.mode = UiMode::GameBoard`
   - Remove PaneFocused state transitions — just use ComponentManager.expand_component() / clear_focus()

5. Update layout derivation:
   - Match on UiMode + ComponentManager.focus_mode instead of UiState variants
   - The layout() methods on per-state structs move to UiStateMachine or a layout module

6. Remove per-state struct files that become unnecessary:
   - states/game_board_pane_focused.rs (replaced by FocusMode::ComponentExpanded)
   - states/review_board_pane_focused.rs (replaced by FocusMode::ComponentExpanded)

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/mod.rs (major: replace statig with UiMode enum)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/ (remove PaneFocused structs, simplify others)
- client-tui/src/ui/render_loop.rs (remove statig usage, simplify fsm access)
- client-tui/src/ui/input.rs (update state transitions)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/renderer.rs (update if any match on UiState)
- client-tui/Cargo.toml (remove statig dependency)

## Acceptance criteria
- statig crate is no longer a dependency
- No unsafe code for FSM access
- UiMode has 4 variants (no PaneFocused)
- Pane focus is tracked solely by ComponentManager.focus_mode
- All screen transitions still work (menu -> game, game -> review, etc.)
- All pane selection/expansion still works
close_reason: Replaced statig FSM with simple UiMode enum (4 variants). Removed statig dependency, all unsafe code, and UiEvent. Added transition_to() method. All 24 tests pass.

title: Compute layout purely from state (remove stored RenderSpec)
description:
## Problem

Each per-state struct (GameBoardState, ReviewBoardState, etc.) stores a `render_spec: RenderSpec` field that is set at construction time. However, the dynamic `layout()` methods on these structs ALREADY compute layout from current state, making the stored RenderSpec partially dead code.

For example:
- GameBoardState::layout() (game_board.rs:102-155) builds layout dynamically from shared.tab_input.active and shared.component_manager.is_visible()
- ReviewBoardState::layout() (review_board.rs:86-121) builds layout dynamically
- But StartScreenState and MatchSummaryState use render_spec.layout.clone() directly (mod.rs:66,71)

The stored RenderSpec creates confusion about whether the static or dynamic layout is used.

## What needs to happen

1. Move all layout computation to a single module/function:
   ```rust
   pub fn compute_layout(mode: &UiMode, fsm: &UiStateMachine) -> Layout
   ```
   This function matches on UiMode and FocusMode to produce the correct layout.

2. Remove the `render_spec` field from all per-state structs:
   - GameBoardState: remove render_spec field
   - ReviewBoardState: remove render_spec field
   - GameBoardPaneFocusedState: remove render_spec field (or remove struct entirely per issue chesstty-h58)
   - ReviewBoardPaneFocusedState: remove render_spec field (or remove struct entirely)
   - StartScreenState: move its simple layout into compute_layout()
   - MatchSummaryState: move its simple layout into compute_layout()

3. Remove the `expanded_panel` field from RenderSpec — pane expansion is tracked by ComponentManager.focus_mode.

4. Update UiStateMachine::layout() to call compute_layout() instead of delegating to per-state structs.

5. Consider whether RenderSpec itself is still needed or if Layout alone suffices.

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/render_spec.rs (simplify RenderSpec or replace with Layout)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/game_board.rs (remove render_spec, keep layout logic)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/review_board.rs (remove render_spec, keep layout logic)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/start_screen.rs (move layout to central function)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/states/match_summary.rs (move layout to central function)
- client-tui/src/ui/fsm/mod.rs (update layout() delegation)

## Acceptance criteria
- No per-state struct stores a RenderSpec
- Layout is computed fresh from UiMode + ComponentManager state each frame
- Layout for all modes (start screen, game board, review board, match summary) renders correctly
- Pane expansion layout derives from ComponentManager.focus_mode, not from a separate UiState variant
close_reason: Removed RenderSpec struct, View enum, and render_spec fields from StartScreenState/MatchSummaryState. Layout is now computed purely from UiMode + UiStateMachine state. Updated tests to use dynamic layout computation.

title: Add Message enum and InputContext struct to input.rs
description:
Add two new types to client-tui/src/ui/input.rs — purely additive, no behavioral changes.

## Message enum (~45 variants)

Define a Message enum representing user intent, organized by domain:

- Noop: key has no effect in current context
- Quit: Ctrl+C
- TogglePanel(Component): @/#/$ panel visibility toggles
- BufferPush(char): character typed in board context
- BufferPop: backspace in board context
- BufferSubmit: Enter with non-empty buffer
- ClearSelection: Esc when a square is selected
- OpenMenu: Esc when no square selected (opens popup menu)
- ActivateTabInput: 'i' key in board context
- TabInputChar(char): validated character in tab input mode
- TabInputBackspace: backspace in tab input mode
- TabInputConfirm: Enter in tab input mode (tab 2)
- TabInputCancel: Esc in tab input mode
- TogglePause: 'p' key in engine modes
- FocusNextPane / FocusPrevPane: Tab/Shift+Tab navigation
- ClearFocus: Esc when a component is focused
- FocusNextSection / FocusPrevSection: Left/Right in component selected
- FocusNextInSection / FocusPrevInSection: Up/Down (j/k) in component selected
- ExpandPane: Enter on expandable component
- ReviewTab(u8): '1'/'2' keys on ReviewSummary component
- ScrollUp / ScrollDown / ScrollToTop / ScrollToBottom: scroll keys (Shift+j/k, J/K, PageUp/PageDown)
- ReviewNextPly / ReviewPrevPly: Right/Left (l/h) in review board context
- ReviewNextCritical / ReviewPrevCritical: n/p in review mode
- ReviewToggleAutoPlay: Space in review mode
- ReviewGoToStart / ReviewGoToEnd: Home/End in review mode
- OpenSnapshotDialog: 's' in review board context
- MenuUp / MenuDown / MenuSelect / MenuCancel: popup menu navigation
- SnapshotNextFocus / SnapshotPrevFocus: Tab/j/k in snapshot dialog
- SnapshotIncrement / SnapshotDecrement: Left/Right in MovesBack focus
- SnapshotSetPlayNow(bool): Left(true)/Right(false) in PlayNow focus
- SnapshotCharInput(char) / SnapshotBackspace: character/backspace in Name focus
- SnapshotConfirm / SnapshotCancel: Enter/Esc in snapshot dialog
- PromotionChar(char): character in promotion dialog
- PromotionCancel: Esc in promotion dialog

## InputContext struct

A lightweight struct built from &GameSession + &UiStateMachine each frame. Contains all the context the pure mapper needs:

- game_mode flags: is_review_mode, has_engine, input_disabled
- modal flags: tab_input_active, popup_menu_active, snapshot_dialog_active, promotion_active
- focus state: focused_component (Option<Component>), expanded (bool)
- board state: has_selected_square
- snapshot dialog context: snapshot_dialog_focus (Option<SnapshotDialogFocus>)
- tab input context: tab_input_tab (usize), tab_input_buffer_len (usize)

title: Introduce Message enum and single update() function
description:
## Problem

Currently there is no unified message/update pattern. Input handling happens through two separate paths:

1. `fsm.handle(&UiEvent::Key(key))` in render_loop.rs:488 — feeds into statig FSM (mostly empty)
2. `input::handle_key(state, fsm, input_buffer, key)` in render_loop.rs:490 — the real handler

Inside input.rs, key events are dispatched through a waterfall of if/match chains that directly mutate both `GameSession` and `UiStateMachine`. There's no intermediate layer that maps raw key events to semantic intent. This makes it hard to:
- Test input handling (need full GameSession + UiStateMachine)
- Reuse logic (same intent from different keys requires duplication)
- Reason about state changes (mutations scattered across match arms)

## What needs to happen

1. Define a Message enum that represents user intent:
   ```rust
   pub enum Message {
       // Board interaction
       SelectSquare(Square),
       MovePiece { from: Square, to: Square },
       PromotePiece(Piece),
       ClearSelection,
       
       // Navigation
       NextPly,
       PrevPly,
       NextCriticalMoment,
       PrevCriticalMoment,
       GoToStart,
       GoToEnd,
       ToggleAutoPlay,
       
       // Pane management
       SelectNextPane,
       SelectPrevPane,
       SelectNextSection,
       SelectPrevSection,
       SelectNextInSection,
       SelectPrevInSection,
       ExpandPane,
       CollapsePaneToBoard,
       
       // Scrolling
       ScrollUp,
       ScrollDown,
       ScrollToTop,
       ScrollToBottom,
       
       // Tab input
       ActivateTabInput,
       TabInputChar(char),
       TabInputConfirm,
       TabInputCancel,
       
       // Toggles
       TogglePanel(Component),
       TogglePause,
       
       // Menus/dialogs
       OpenMenu,
       CloseMenu,
       MenuSelect,
       MenuUp,
       MenuDown,
       OpenSnapshotDialog,
       
       // App lifecycle
       Quit,
       ReturnToMenu,
       SuspendSession,
       Undo,
   }
   ```

2. Create a key-to-message mapping function:
   ```rust
   fn map_key_to_message(
       key: KeyEvent,
       mode: &UiMode,
       focus: &FocusMode,
       game_mode: &GameMode,
       tab_input_active: bool,
       popup_active: bool,
   ) -> Option<Message>
   ```
   This is a PURE function — no mutation, just maps context + key -> intent.

3. Create a single update function:
   ```rust
   async fn update(
       state: &mut GameSession,
       fsm: &mut UiStateMachine,
       msg: Message,
   ) -> AppAction
   ```
   All state mutations go through this function. No direct mutation of fsm/state from key handlers.

4. Update render_loop.rs to use the new pattern:
   ```rust
   if let Some(Event::Key(key)) = term_event {
       if let Some(msg) = map_key_to_message(key, &fsm.mode, ...) {
           match update(&mut state, &mut fsm, msg).await {
               AppAction::Continue => {}
               AppAction::Quit => return Ok(ExitReason::Quit),
               // ...
           }
       }
   }
   ```

5. Migrate input.rs handlers into the update() function, organized by message variant rather than by context/focus mode.

## Files to modify
- client-tui/src/ui/message.rs (NEW: Message enum + key mapping)
- client-tui/src/ui/update.rs (NEW: single update function)
- client-tui/src/ui/input.rs (refactor into update.rs, then remove or reduce to key mapping)
- client-tui/src/ui/render_loop.rs (use new map -> update pattern)
- client-tui/src/ui/mod.rs (add new modules)

## Acceptance criteria
- All key events go through map_key_to_message() -> update() pipeline
- No direct fsm/state mutation outside of update()
- map_key_to_message() is a pure function (testable without GameSession)
- update() is the single state mutation entry point
- All existing key bindings produce identical behavior
- The unsafe { fsm.inner_mut() } is gone

description:

## Changes to render_loop.rs

In run_ui_loop(), replace the keyboard event handling block (around line 462-493):

BEFORE:
  if let Some(Event::Key(key)) = term_event {
      match input::handle_key(state, &mut fsm, &mut input_buffer, key).await {

title: Implement update() function and fix input_phase transitions
description:
Add the async update() function to client-tui/src/ui/input.rs — the single mutation entry point for all Message variants. Also move handle_input() from render_loop.rs into input.rs and fix the broken input_phase state machine.

## Public function

pub async fn update(
    state: &mut GameSession,
    fsm: &mut UiStateMachine,
    input_buffer: &mut String,
    msg: Message,
) -> AppAction

Match on all Message variants and extract mutation logic from the existing handle_* functions.

## Message variant handlers

### Noop -> AppAction::Continue

### Quit -> AppAction::Quit

### TogglePanel(component)
- fsm.toggle_component_visibility(component)

### BufferPush(c) -> input_buffer.push(c)
### BufferPop -> input_buffer.pop()

### BufferSubmit (complex — incorporates handle_input from render_loop.rs)
Match on fsm.input_phase:
- SelectPiece: parse square from input_buffer, call state.select_square(square), transition fsm.input_phase = InputPhase::SelectDestination. If square not selectable, show error, stay in SelectPiece.
- SelectDestination: parse square, call state.try_move_to(square).await. If try_move_to returns Ok and the move needed promotion (state.status_message contains 'promotion' or check needs_promotion logic), transition to SelectPromotion { from, to }. If move succeeded normally, transition back to SelectPiece. If error, show message.
- SelectPromotion { from, to }: parse piece letter (q/r/b/n/queen/rook/bishop/knight), call state.execute_promotion(from, to, piece).await, transition back to SelectPiece.

IMPORTANT: The key fix here is that input_phase ACTUALLY TRANSITIONS between states. Currently the comments say 'input_phase now handled by FSM' but no code writes to fsm.input_phase. The transitions are:
- select_square() success -> SelectDestination
- try_move_to() success (no promotion) -> SelectPiece
- try_move_to() needs promotion -> SelectPromotion { from, to }
- execute_promotion() success -> SelectPiece
- clear_selection / cancel -> SelectPiece

Also handle 'undo'/'u' command: check state.is_undo_allowed(), call state.undo().await.

### ClearSelection
- state.clear_selection(), input_buffer.clear()
- fsm.input_phase = InputPhase::SelectPiece

### OpenMenu (with auto-pause logic from existing Esc handler)
- input_buffer.clear()
- If has_engine: save paused_before_menu, pause if not already paused
- fsm.popup_menu = Some(PopupMenuState::new(&state.mode))

### ActivateTabInput -> fsm.tab_input.activate()

### TabInputChar(c)
- Push to fsm.tab_input.typeahead_buffer
- Tab 1 auto-advance: if current_tab == 0 and buffer len == 2, parse square, check selectable, call state.select_square(), fsm.tab_input.advance_to_destination(). If invalid, clear buffer.

### TabInputBackspace
- If buffer empty and current_tab == 1: go back to tab 0, clear from_square, clear_selection
- Else: pop from buffer

### TabInputConfirm
- Only meaningful in tab 2 (current_tab == 1): parse destination, verify legal move, deactivate tab input, call state.try_move_to().await
- Handle input_phase transition here too

### TabInputCancel
- fsm.tab_input.deactivate(), state.clear_selection()

### TogglePause (existing pause/resume logic)
- If paused: client.resume().await
- If not paused: client.pause().await

### FocusNextPane / FocusPrevPane
- Use existing handle_tab_navigation() logic (compute layout, find next/prev component)

### ClearFocus -> fsm.clear_focus()

### FocusNextSection / FocusPrevSection
- fsm.prev_section / fsm.next_section with layout, then fsm.select_component()
- NOTE: needs the focused component from the message context or from fsm state

### FocusNextInSection / FocusPrevInSection
- fsm.next_in_section / fsm.prev_in_section, then select_component()

### ExpandPane
- Get focused component, check expandable, fsm.expand_component()

### ReviewTab(n) -> fsm.review_tab = n

### ScrollUp/ScrollDown/ScrollToTop/ScrollToBottom
- Get focused component, use fsm.component_scroll_mut() with SCROLL_INCREMENT
- ScrollToTop: set to 0, ScrollToBottom: set to u16::MAX

### Review navigation (ReviewNextPly, ReviewPrevPly, etc.)
- Delegate to review_state methods (same logic as existing handle_review_navigation)

### OpenSnapshotDialog
- Get current_ply and game_id from review_state
- fsm.snapshot_dialog = Some(SnapshotDialogState::new(...))

### MenuUp/MenuDown/MenuSelect/MenuCancel
- MenuUp/Down: menu.move_up()/move_down()
- MenuSelect: extract selected item, close menu, restore_pause_state, execute item action
- MenuCancel: close menu, restore_pause_state

### Snapshot dialog messages
- NextFocus/PrevFocus: dialog.next_focus()/prev_focus()
- Increment/Decrement: dialog.increment_moves_back()/decrement_moves_back() with positions
- SetPlayNow(val): dialog.play_immediately = val
- CharInput(c)/Backspace: dialog.name_buffer.push(c)/pop()
- Confirm: full confirm logic (terminal check, FEN extraction, pre-history building, play-immediately vs save)
- Cancel: fsm.snapshot_dialog = None

### PromotionChar(c)
- Auto-execute: if c is q/r/b/n, immediately execute_promotion with the from/to from InputPhase::SelectPromotion
- Transition fsm.input_phase back to SelectPiece
- Invalid chars: ignore (Noop-like)

### PromotionCancel
- state.clear_selection(), input_buffer.clear()
- fsm.input_phase = InputPhase::SelectPiece

## Private helpers
- restore_pause_state(state) — move existing function, keep as private helper
- handle_tab_navigation logic can be inlined or kept as helper

## Acceptance criteria
- update() handles all Message variants
- input_phase transitions correctly: SelectPiece -> SelectDestination -> SelectPiece (or -> SelectPromotion -> SelectPiece)
- handle_input() moved from render_loop.rs to input.rs (as private helper or inlined into BufferSubmit)
- cargo build succeeds (function added but not yet called)
- All existing tests pass
close_reason: Implemented update() function in input.rs. Added input_phase transitions correctly in handle_input. BufferSubmit now calls render_loop::handle_input. All Message variants are handled. Build and tests pass.
